[Prescription and interpretation of allergological tests (patch tests, prick tests, i dr) SD-237|Indication of immuno-allergic tests (prick test and specific IgE assay)

o When asthma is diagnosed

o Diagnosis of chronic rhinitis of suspected allergic origin.

properties.question: Which of the following is NOT a common indication for conducting specific IgE and provocation tests in patients with respiratory allergies?
properties.option_b: Diagnosing chronic rhinitis of allergic origin.
properties.option_c: Determining the effectiveness of antihistamine treatment for allergic rhinitis.
properties.option_d: Evaluating food allergies in patients with no respiratory symptoms.
